Articles.Content:
Ever felt the need to explain KSP to somebody? Did it take you too long to talk about everything you can do in the game?

Well, this short movie tries to do it in 4 minutes. Starting out with the great Kerbal animations from Squad (because nothing says cute Kerbal like the trailers), continuing on how failing and succeeding lies close together, an intermezzo with asteroids, sience and stuff and finally finishing up with the community.

Some pictures to get you in the mood:

Javascript is disabled. View full album

This started out as a small test back in July. Instead of doing random stuff it was themed with KSP. After some shots came together D.Fontana thought of a "story" to tell and the version you see here came together.

This movie stays true to KSP, so no post processing or effects that are not in the game (well, the smoke when the rocket takes of is the 1 exception), what you see is what you get as we deemed appropriate for a "This is XY" movie.

But enough words, enjoy.

P.S. after this was finished we started doing some ModShowcases because, why not, we are used to play with some great tools that the modders provided.

Edited November 19, 2014 by Geneborg
I must say, I wouldn't mind floating text banners like these as a Help facility in the actual game.

Thx for commenting, hope you enjoyed the video.

Yes, indeed, in some context additional info could be helpful sometimes, maybe as option to show/hide in the menu. We noticed while making the clip that some scenes didn't explain themselves without any contextual info so the "banners" where the answer to that.

Nice use of trailer footage. I also like the banners. (though not sure about some of the ones that go all the way across the screen.)

This is a good summary of the game, as it is currently.

I also like the banners. (though not sure about some of the ones that go all the way across the screen.)

Very nice video! I think it does depict KSP very well in its current state!

Well its been a week, time to look back.

Seems that the hope of gathering enough traction to get this clip outside the community to spark interest in "non KSP players" will not happen, the realization set in on Wednesday. We missed the mark, obviously. Maybe there will be a next time, closer to 1.0.

No, you didn't miss the mark! Your video was fantastic. You just need it to be showcased in a Video Wednesdays to give it a headstart on the views. Send it in to Rowsdower and ask for it to be showcased. You should also have posted this thread in the KSP Fanworks thread, since it's more of a special work of art rather than a livestream or easy-to-make video. Ask for it to be moved in this thread.

Thx Andrew, appreciate the sentiment. I'm sure Squad has seen this and they have their reasons to or not to feature it on video wednesday (see the PN i wrote you), thats their prerogative. I'm sure there are many others that made some clips that would have liked to be featured, so i think its not for me to push on that issue, thats like saying "feature me i'm better then everyone else".
aaaannnd, there's Antarctica at 3:37. Nice video
didn't get the comment at first, then i realized "sure, the screenshots", haha
how did you get those launch effects at test?????!!??!?!?!!? I NEEED THEEEEEMMMMMM

Ah, sir, you are the first to notice/mention it. Thats the only CGI shot i made manipulating raw-footage to create the illusion of a perfect rocket-launch. Sry to say, its not an ingame-mod, its pure CGI.

Maybe SQUAD will work on that on the road to 1.0, they reworked explosions, it should be doable to rework launch-smoke.
